reviewText: This is a pretty good dvd of the series that has our hero "Hiccup" still taking up the dragon's cause, fighting new foes including "Mildew" a grumpy old man who tries to stir up the villagers of "Berk" to get rid of the dragons. Hiccup finds new ways of helping the dragons and in doing so, finds much more than what is on the surface of the dragons and himself in the process. This program was well done and hopefully, is the first of many dvds from Dreamwork's  tv series of Rider's of Berk.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm not sure why I see all these 1 star reveiws from folks who either didn't even buy the dvd, or didn't bother to read the online description before they did buy it, to see that it contains only the first 4 episodes of the series.  If you have issues with the way things are marketed, call Dreamworks and take it up with the marketing department, don't pan the content in a biased review. If you want to wait for the full season release, I'm guessing that will be an option down the road once the current season ends.  Either way, the series animation and stories are great and 9.99 isn't a bad deal at all for kids who will watch it over and over again, especially considering most movies are about 88 minutes in length, run upwards of 15 to 20 dollars or more and may not be re-watched as often.
Title: N/A

reviewText: It's so nice to be able to watch the Dragons: Riders of Berk at home on tv.  We are impatiently waiting for the next installment of "How to Train Your Dragon" for the theater (2013?), but until then we can enjoy the series.  Although I catch this show on tv I believe on Nickolodeon or Cartoon Network, I ordered this DVD to add to our animation collection.  We just can't get enough of the Dragons!  Toothless is adorable!
summary: Hang out with Hiccup and Toothless everyday!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I fell in love with the movie, How To Train Your Dragon and when this first of what I hope is the first of many DVD's of this wonderful follow up to the movie.  The same voice cast is used for the Dragon Riders but the adult characters have sound alike voices.  I guess Gerard Butler and Craig Fergusen are just a tad to expensive for a TV show.  But the are and animation are just as good as the movie.  The kids are just as funny and the dragons are just as weird and wonderful as they are in the movie.  If you don't have Cable or Satellite to watch Cartoon Network then this is a must have if you are fan of Dragon Riders of Berk.
summary: A great TV show based on a wonderful movie
Title: N/A

reviewText: This Dragons DVD features four episodes from the tv series with all the dragons that my boys love and then some.  It is a show about training a dragon, rather than killing it - basically how to co-exisit!  The show is cute and silly, and probably perfect for 5-9 year olds - although I admit I don't mind watching it.  There isn't a show out there like this one, which is a nice change of pace from our usual tv routine.  Since it includes episodes, it is perfect to watch just one or keep watching them.  Yes they are re-peats from the tv series but again it is nice to have them all on one DVD to watch anytime!  You also receive five collectible dragon cards to play with.
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you enjoyed the fist movie in this series, How To Train Your Dragon, or have been reading the book series by the same name, you will love this new addition to the mix. This DVD has some great episodes filled with both adventure and fun. I have to say that I was not even aware that they had made this into a series until I was able to review this DVD, and after seeing it, I wish I had knows, as the episodes were great(and so funny).You also have the opportunity to see and interact with some amazing new dragons that were not in the movie, which was a lot of fun as I am always impressed with the characteristics and personalities that the artists at Dreamworks have come up with, as they are all so unique which make watching this series and the original movie so much fun to watch.Overall though this DVD is worth watching, as it adds much to the overall How To Train Your Dragon series, and I, for one, hope that they will continue this series in the future!

reviewText: I would like to express my disappointment in Cartoon Networks/Dreamworks insatiable greed.  I love certain programs like Adventure Time.  However, I am outraged on how there are now, not one, but five random selections of episodes out on DVD.  I will take time out of my day to make sure reviews on all websites that sell these partial seasons will clearly tell people how CN/DW is driven by greed and not to buy these mixed seasons and not to support partial season DVDs.  You can put crap in a shiny box and call it a favor, but it is still crap.  So many customers demand full seasons ONLY!  You may fool the average consumer, but with a little education, my fellow peers will have their eyes opened to CN/DW's deceit of its customers and insatiable greed.  What ever happened to producing quality products?  What ever happened to companies that didn't try to gouge the customer and fool them into thinking they are getting a good deal?  The DVD's cost you way less than a dollar to produce, but yet you want to try and fool the common customer to buy these mixed seasons of wonderful shows. Sadly, taking care of the customer and offering quality products appears to be a thing of the past.Please don't hack up the dream works dragons of Burke when you put those seasons out on DVD.  I will follow the releases and also educate the average customer on your business tactics and lack of general ethics.  My voice will be heard, if not by CN/DW, but by the average consumer.I don't normally complain, but I am sick and tired of large companies scamming and price gouging the loyal fans for the sake of a few extra bucks.  America is no longer a producer of quality, now it seems we are a producer of deception and greed.  You should be ASHAMED CARTOON NETWORK/DREAMWORKS!
summary: BOO! Corporate greed causes sale of partial Seasons! Don't Buy ANY!

reviewText: I love the spirit of Dragons.  The teenagers bring a lot to the table with humor and learning about life.  The dragons are dragons of course and their natural instincts always come out.  I think of them as teenagers and best friends of the Berk kids.  A keeper at any price.
summary: Riders of Berk Are At It Again!

reviewText: My children loved the How to Train Your Dragon movie and they were so excited to see the legend would carry on with the new series, Dragons, Rider of Berk. Join Hiccup and Toothless through four all new adventures on the small screen. You'll see your old favorites, but you'll also get to meet some fun new characters, including new dragons. So far, the series has started out with a bang. I love how the show is loaded with excitement and adventure, but contains minimal violence so the series is appropriate for kids of all ages.My son has watched it at least five times in the week since it arrived.Episodes on this DVD include:How to Start a Dragon AcademyViking for HireAnimal HouseThe Terrible TwosThe DVD set also comes with five cool trading cards that kids can collect and that work along with the free app that was mentioned above. All in all, a this DVD is an awesome deal and fun for the whole family.***I received a copy of this film in exchange for a fair review. All opinions are my own. See more reviews on my blog, New Age Mama***
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD has 4 episodes on it, these 4 episodes are also on Part 1 of Dragons Riders of Berk. You actually don’t need this DVD if you plan to purchase the Part 1 .I have to say I really love this series. They got the actors who voices the characters in the movie to voice them for the TV series too. So there is no change up from movie to TV. I think later in the 2nd season Defenders of Berk they did replace the voice of the female twin.My 13 year old son and I both love the How to Dragon your Dragon TV series. So worth watching, whether you have kiddos or not.

reviewText: I am very confused about this disc. How could they release the series on Nov 20 when new episodes are still airing? And why would anyone buy a disc with only 4 episodes instead of waiting for the complete first season? It doesn't make any sense. I love this show (the rating is for the disc not the show), but I'm not throwing my money away on only a partial season. I will wait for the full season to be released. This is just strange.

reviewText: I got this for an 8 year old boy who loved How To Train Your Dragon. The first thing he said after watching the rented version was, "I want to buy this!" He was engaged the entire time. The stories are short, sweet, and age appropriate. The animation is great. It's enjoyable, clean and has a good message.

reviewerName: The Movie Guy "Movies from A to Z"
reviewText: I buy and watch these dragon episodes for my 9 year old niece...I keep telling myself. She loves this stuff. This DVD consists of 4 TV episodes which deal with the growing pains of having a wild animal becoming domesticated. There are universal truths about pets which would apply to dogs etc. should your family have one and you are trying to teach the munchkin that animals do what is natural to them. The trick is to control them without harming them. In these episodes minor characters are developed and play larger roles.What I found most interesting was the extra feature. They are making a live stage performance of the film, including flying, underwater scenes, and fire breathing dragons. And to think I was fascinated by "It's a Small World" in 1964.The short features are limited to 22 minute episodes, which is not enough time to tell a great tale, but long enough to tell an interesting one.
Title: N/A

reviewText: So here's the thing for the purchaser to know if they're shopping here at Amazo: this DVD only contains four episodes of this great spin-off TV series from the "How To Train Your Dragon Movie".  It's fine for what it is but you get so much more of this and more content for hardly any more moolah by purchasing the "Riders of Berk" Part 1 DVD.  Buy that instead.
summary: Buy the DVD that is entitled "Riders of Berk--Part 1" instead of this.  Get the value you deserve.
